00001 #ifndef __BASE_H
00002 #define __BASE_H
00003 
00004 #include <stdio.h>
00005 
00006 /* Defining the sizes of each field. */
00007 #define TITLE_LENGTH   200
00008 #define TYPE_LENGTH    100
00009 #define AUTHOR_LENGTH  125
00010 #define YEAR_LENGTH    4
00011 #define VALUE_LENGTH   12
00012 #define IMG_LENGTH     9
00013 
00014 /* Total size of a register. */
00015 #define REG_SIZE (TITLE_LENGTH + TYPE_LENGTH + AUTHOR_LENGTH + \
00016                   YEAR_LENGTH + VALUE_LENGTH + IMG_LENGTH)
00017 
00018 /* The main structure which holds data about
00019  * each register in the database
00020  * We use FIELD_LENGTH+1 because we need one more
00021  * byte to hold the '\0' when using fgets.
00022  */
00023 typedef struct
00024 {
00025   char title[TITLE_LENGTH+1];       /* The artwork's title */
00026   char type[TYPE_LENGTH+1];         /* The artwork's type  */
00027   char author[AUTHOR_LENGTH+1];     /* The artworks author */
00028   char year[YEAR_LENGTH+1];         /* The year the artwork was made */
00029   char value[VALUE_LENGTH+1];       /* The artwork's value */
00030   char img[IMG_LENGTH+1];           /* The register's identifier */
00031 } artwork_info;
00032 
00033 /*
00034  * getValidImagePath
00035  *
00036  * Receives the image identifier and returns it with the '.' before
00037  * the extension.
00038  * One must save the returned pointer and free it after using it.
00039  */
00040 char* baseGetValidImagePath(const char* s);
00041 
00042 /*
00043  * baseIsValidIdentifier
00044  *
00045  * Checks if the image identifier is valid.
00046  * This time we use strtol to get past the digits and also
00047  * check the file extension.
00048  *
00049  * Returns 1 on error and 0 for OK.
00050  */
00051 int baseIsValidIdentifier(const char* name);
00052 
00053 /*
00054  * readArtworkRecord
00055  *
00056  * Reads one record from the database file /base/ and
00057  * stores it in /info/.
00058  *
00059  * Returns 0 on succes and 1 on error.
00060  */
00061 int baseReadArtworkRecord(FILE* base, artwork_info* info);
00062 
00063 /*
00064  * writeData
00065  *
00066  * Writes the data from the struct pointed at by *info
00067  * to the file pointed at by *file.
00068  * Writes it according to the requested parameters.
00069  */
00070 int baseWriteData(FILE *file, artwork_info *info);
00071 
00072 #endif
